intro: Alaticaulia concinna, commonly known as the slender-stemmed alpine plant, is a species native to high-altitude regions of South America. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form, which helps it survive in harsh, cold environments. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, reducing water loss. Alaticaulia concinna is adapted to rocky soils and is often found in alpine meadows and mountain slopes.
